title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But Lesley wasimmediately on his guard. He left his position betwixt Edinburgh aud Leith, and look one which covered the city to the westward, aud was protectedby the Water of Leith, and lhe several cuts, drains,and mill-leads, at Saughton, Colibridge, and thehouses and villages in that quarter. Hert Cromwellagain found the Scots in order of batlle, aud againwas obliged to withdraw afler a distant cannonade.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But Lesley was immediately on his guard. He left his position betwixt Edinburgh and Leith, andtook one which covered the city to the westward, and was protected by theWater of Leith, and the several cuts, drains, and mill-leads, at Saughton, Coltbridge, and the houses and villages in that quarter. Here Cromwell again soundthe Scots in order of battle, and again was obliged to withdraw aster a distantcannonade.
